Type.Name: HTML

TypeSignature.Value: public class HTML : Gtk.Layout, Implementor, IWrapper, IWrapper, IDisposable

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: Lightweight HTML rendering widget.

remarks.para: is a lightweight HTML rendering widget, as well as as simple graphical HTML editor.
Developers can also use it as a widget container (). It is an easy way for viewing HTML documents in your application and for layout UI of your application throught HTML.
does not have support for CSS or JavaScript.
The following sample is a very minimal web browser.

Docs.summary: Constructs an instance of a Gtk.HTML widget
Docs.remarks: This is a low-level routine, and should only be used to initialize an instance of a derivative class.

Docs.summary: Locates an object whose id is provided
Docs.param: The id assigned to an object in the HTML stream
Docs.returns: An IntPtr to the internal HTMLObject

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Export (string type, Gtk.HTMLSaveReceiverFn receiver);

Docs.summary: Sends HTML out from the widget.
Docs.returns: a , true if the export happened successfully, false if otherwise.

Docs.summary: Copies the selection to the clipboard.
Docs.remarks: Copies the selection into the clipboard.

Docs.summary: Selects the word under the cursor.
Docs.remarks: This routine selects the word under the cursor.

Docs.summary: Changes the font style by adjusting flags from bold to regular or vice-versa. For a full list of possible flags, see .
Selects a paragraph.
Resets the magnification of the text to 100% (normal).

MemberSignature.Value: public void Write (Gtk.HTMLStream handle, string buffer, int size);

Docs.summary: Writes bytes of content from to .
Undoes the last operation.
Docs.remarks: If the widget is Editable, this undoes the last operation.

Docs.summary: Cuts the selection into the clipboard.
Docs.remarks: If the widget is editable, this cuts the selection into the clipboard; Otherwise it just copies the selection into the clipboard.

Docs.summary: Computes url from widget base url.
Docs.param: The new component of the url.

Docs.summary: This method is designed to be called after the style, indentation, or other font attributes of an editable HTML widget have changed.
Docs.remarks: When this is called, it will trigger the emission of signals for paragraphs whose indentation or style has changed.

Docs.summary: Starts incremental content updating.

remarks.para: Use the Begin method to push new HTML content into the widget. The content type is expected to be in the format defined by , which by default is "html/text; charset=utf-8".
Compile and run:
mcs sample.cs -pkg:gtkhtml-sharp
echo " Hello World " | mono sample.exe

Docs.summary: Sets up internal references to all images.
Docs.remarks: FIXME: verify this.

Docs.summary: Paste clipboard contents into editor
Docs.param: Whether to paste as a citation.
Docs.remarks: If the widget is in editing mode (see ), the contents of the clipboard are pasted into the HTML editor. If the value of is true, then the contents are pasted as a citation.

Docs.summary: Set up an empty widget.

MemberSignature.Value: public void End (Gtk.HTMLStream handle, Gtk.HTMLStreamStatus status);

Docs.summary: Ends incremental updating
Docs.param: The representing the state of the stream when closed.

remarks.para: Closes the represented by and notifies the HTML widget that it should not expect any more content from that stream.
Compile and run:
mcs sample.cs -pkg:gtkhtml-sharp
echo " Hello World " | mono sample.exe

Docs.summary: Redoes the last Undone operation
Docs.remarks: If the widget is editable, this redoes the last undone operation.

Docs.summary: Adds HTML to the end of the HTML currently being rendered by the widget.
Selects the line the cursor is currently on.
Removes an indent level.
Selects all the contents.
Docs.remarks: Selects all of the contents of the HTML widget.

Docs.summary: Makes the edit cursor visible.
Docs.returns: a , true if the operation was a success.

Docs.summary: Starts incremental content updating. With a specific content type.
Docs.param: The content type for the data to be streamed.

remarks.para: Use the Begin method to push new HTML content into the widget. The content type has to be specified (like this for example: "html/text; charset=utf-8").
Compile and run:
mcs sample.cs -pkg:gtkhtml-sharp
echo " Hello World " | mono sample.exe

Internal constructor
Docs.returns: An instance of HTML, wrapping the C object.

remarks.para: This is an internal constructor, and should not be used by user code.

Docs.summary: Creates an empty widget.

remarks.para: It creates an empty widget. The returned widget is empty, and defaults to not be editable.

Docs.summary: Whether the contents can be edited.
Docs.returns: if the contents are editable, otherwise.
Docs.remarks: Whether this instance can be used as an HTML editor. Note: must be called before this can be set = .

Docs.summary: The indentation level of a paragraph.
The base URL of this document.
The title of this HTML document.
The default content type.
The style of a paragraph.
To be added
The current widget magnification level.
The alignment of text (right, left, center)
Whether to allow framesets in this widget.
Fired when the font style under the cursor is changed.
Occurs when the title changes in HTML
Docs.remarks: This event is raised when the HTML parser encounters the <title> tag on the HTML stream. To get the title, use the property.

Docs.summary: Fired when the base URL of the document is changed.
Fired when the size of text is changed.
Fired when the text style of this paragraph is changed.
Fired after a webpage is finished loading.
Occurs when the cursor moves.
Docs.remarks: This event is raised when the widget is in editing mode and the cursor has moved.

Docs.summary: Fired when a command is issued to the widget.
Occurs when a url is Requested

remarks.para: This event is raised when an URL is requested (typically an image).

The following example shows how a simple HTML source that requests an image (hello.png). If the file is found, then it will be streamed into the HTML widget. The model allows for data to be delivered as it comes, and when the data has all arrived, the End method can be invoked on the html stream provided by the .
Make sure there is a "hello.png" file in your directory to see it, otherwise the sample will show the "broken image link" image.
mcs sample.cs -pkg:gtkhtml-sharp
mono sample.exe

Docs.summary: Fired after an IFRAME is created.
Fired when the widget is scrolled.
Fired when the indent level of the current paragraph is changed.
Fired when the alignment of the current paragraph is changed.
Fired when the text color to insert is changed.
Occurs when the user clicks on a hyperlink

remarks.para: This event is raised when the user clicks on a hyperlink in the HTML widget.
mcs sample.cs -pkg:gtkhtml-sharp
mono sample.exe
Click on the "me" link to see the message on the console.

Docs.summary: Fired when a form submit button is clicked.
Fired when an HTTP redirect is received.
Occurs when the user hovers over a hyper-link.

remarks.para: This event is raised when the mouse pointer hovers over a hyper link or leaves a link. In the former case the value of is the link target, and in the later the empty string.
mcs sample.cs -pkg:gtkhtml-sharp
mono sample.exe
Hover in and out of the link to see the effects on the console.

Docs.summary: Fired when the base URL target is changed.
